title: Google\Cloud\BigQuery\QueryJobConfiguration
name: QueryJobConfiguration
description: Represents a configuration for a query job. For more information on the available settings please see the Jobs configuration API documentation.

params.name: config
params.description: A set of configuration options for a job.

params.name: location
params.description: The geographic location in which the job is executed.

methods.name: allowLargeResults
methods.description: Sets whether or not the query can produce arbitrarily large result tables at a slight cost in performance. Only applies to queries performed with legacy SQL dialect and requires a Google\Cloud\BigQuery\QueryJobConfiguration::destinationTable() to be set.

params.name: allowLargeResults
params.description: Whether or not to allow large result sets.

methods.name: clustering
methods.description:
Set the clustering specification for the table.

Refer to BigQuery documentation for a guide to clustered tables and constraints imposed by the service.

methods.name: createDisposition
methods.description: Sets whether the job is allowed to create new tables.

methods.name: defaultDataset
methods.description: Sets the default dataset to use for unqualified table names in the query.

methods.name: destinationEncryptionConfiguration
methods.description: Sets the custom encryption configuration (e.g., Cloud KMS keys).

methods.name: destinationTable
methods.description: Sets the table where the query results should be stored. If not set, a new table will be created to store the results. This property must be set for large results that exceed the maximum response size.

methods.name: flattenResults
methods.description:
Sets whether or not to flatten all nested and repeated fields in the query results. Only applies to queries performed with legacy SQL dialect.

Google\Cloud\BigQuery\QueryJobConfiguration::allowLargeResults() must be true if this is set to false.

methods.name: maximumBillingTier
methods.description: Sets the billing tier limit for this job. Queries that have resource usage beyond this tier will fail (without incurring a charge). If unspecified, this will be set to your project default.

methods.name: maximumBytesBilled
methods.description: Sets a bytes billed limit for this job. Queries that will have bytes billed beyond this limit will fail (without incurring a charge). If unspecified, this will be set to your project default.

methods.name: parameters
methods.description:
Sets parameters to be used on the query. Only available for standard SQL queries.

For examples of usage please see Google\Cloud\BigQuery\BigQueryClient::runQuery().

params.name: parameters
params.description: Parameters to use on the query. When providing a non-associative array positional parameters (?) will be used. When providing an associative array named parameters will be used (@name).

methods.name: priority
methods.description: Sets a priority for the query.

methods.name: query
methods.description: Sets the SQL query.

methods.name: schemaUpdateOptions
methods.description: Sets options to allow the schema of the destination table to be updated as a side effect of the query job. Schema update options are supported in two cases: when writeDisposition is "WRITE_APPEND"; when writeDisposition is "WRITE_TRUNCATE" and the destination table is a partition of a table, specified by partition decorators. For normal tables, "WRITE_TRUNCATE" will always overwrite the schema.

params.name: schemaUpdateOptions
params.description: Schema update options. Acceptable values include "ALLOW_FIELD_ADDITION" (allow adding a nullable field to the schema), "ALLOW_FIELD_RELAXATION" (allow relaxing a required field in the original schema to nullable).

methods.name: tableDefinitions
methods.description: Sets table definitions for querying an external data source outside of BigQuery. Describes the data format, location and other properties of the data source.

methods.name: timePartitioning
methods.description:
Sets time-based partitioning for the destination table.

Only one of timePartitioning and rangePartitioning should be specified.

methods.name: rangePartitioning
methods.description:
Sets range partitioning specification for the destination table.

Only one of timePartitioning and rangePartitioning should be specified.

methods.name: useLegacySql
methods.description: Sets whether or not to use legacy SQL dialect. When not set, defaults to false in this client.

params.name: useLegacySql
params.description: Whether or not to use legacy SQL dialect.

methods.name: useQueryCache
methods.description: Sets whether or not to use the query cache.

params.name: useQueryCache
params.description: Whether or not to use the query cache.

methods.name: userDefinedFunctionResources
methods.description: Sets user-defined function resources used in the query.

params.name: userDefinedFunctionResources
params.description: User-defined function resources used in the query. This is to be formatted as a list of sub-arrays containing either a key resourceUri or inlineCode.

methods.name: writeDisposition
methods.description: Sets the action that occurs if the destination table already exists. Each action is atomic and only occurs if BigQuery is able to complete the job successfully. Creation, truncation and append actions occur as one atomic update upon job completion.

params.name: writeDisposition
params.description: The write disposition. Acceptable values include "WRITE_TRUNCATE", "WRITE_APPEND", "WRITE_EMPTY". Defaults to "WRITE_EMPTY".

methods.name: dryRun
methods.description:
Sets dryRun flag. If set to true, don't actually run this job. A valid query will return a mostly empty response with some processing statistics, while an invalid query will return the same error it would if it wasn't a dry run.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\BigQuery\JobConfigurationTrait

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Whether or not to execute as a dry run.

methods.name: jobIdPrefix
methods.description:
Sets a prefix for the job ID.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\BigQuery\JobConfigurationTrait

params.name: jobIdPrefix
params.description: If provided, the job ID will be of format {$jobIdPrefix}-{jobId}.

methods.name: labels
methods.description:
Sets the labels associated with the job. Labels can use these to organize and group jobs. Label keys and values can be no longer than 63 characters, can only contain lowercase letters, numeric characters, underscores and dashes. International characters are allowed. Label values are optional.

Label keys must start with a letter and each label in the list must have a different key.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\BigQuery\JobConfigurationTrait

methods.name: location
methods.description:
Specifies the geographic location of the job. Required for jobs started outside of the US and EU regions.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\BigQuery\JobConfigurationTrait

params.name: location
params.description: The geographic location of the job. Defaults to a location specified in the client configuration, if provided, or through location metadata fetched by a network request (by calling Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Table::reload(), for example).
